page.title: 10ABBERLEY HALL CLOCK TOWER
page.content: The clock tower was built in{1883}by {John Joseph Jones}the owner of the hall. It stands on Merritts Hill, which is 700ft. high, and can be seen from the surrounding countryside. The tower stands{161ft.}high and is a mixture of 13th.and 14th. century Gothic styles, designed by{P.St.Aubyn. It is thought that the tower was erected to improve the Abberley Hall estate in competition with Lord Dudley at Witley Court.The large room halfway up was used by the owner's wife as a sewing room. The tower contained a {carillon}which played tunes every three hours, from a selection of forty two in addition to chiming the hours and quarter hours.The carillon machine and sixteen of the bells were removed in{1939.}The clock now chimes on the five remaining bells.In the second world war it was an observation post.
